skill.name: validate-requirements
skill.description: Validate that input meets prerequisites based on the user's saved standards for the project type. Use at the start of any quality pipeline to ensure the user has provided sufficient requirements.
skill.summary: Validate that input meets prerequisites based on the user's saved standards for the project type. Us...
skill.author: AbeJitsu

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown documentation defining how an AI should validate user input requirements. No network calls, no command execution, no sensitive data access beyond intended scope.

content.value_statement: Poor requirements lead to poor outputs. This skill checks user input for completeness, clarity, and standards alignment before work begins. It acts as the first gate in a quality pipeline.
actual_capabilities: Check input completeness against project standards
Validate expected formats and required context
Return structured validation results with actionable feedback
limitations: Does not modify or generate code itself
Cannot access external APIs or services
Relies on user having saved standards configuration
Provides validation only, does not perform the actual task

use_cases.title: Validate feature requests
use_cases.description: Ensure user stories and feature requests contain enough detail for development teams to act on.

use_cases.title: Check code generation prompts
use_cases.description: Verify prompts include necessary context, constraints, and examples before code generation begins.

use_cases.title: Validate content briefs
use_cases.description: Confirm content requests include topic, audience, format, and key points before writing starts.

prompt_templates.title: Basic validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use validate-requirements to check if my input has enough information to proceed. Report any missing details.

prompt_templates.title: Project-specific
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my requirements against the project type standards. Tell me what I need to add or clarify.

prompt_templates.title: Code request
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if my code request includes: purpose, inputs, outputs, constraints, and examples. Suggest what is missing.

prompt_templates.title: Content brief
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my content brief for completeness: topic, audience, format, length, and key points to cover.

output: - Missing component purpose (where will it be used?)
- No behavior details (keyboard nav, open/close, etc.)
Recommendation: Ask user to provide more detail before generating

best_practices: Use this skill at the start of any quality pipeline to catch issues early
Be specific about what is missing rather than just marking as invalid
Ask 1-2 clarifying questions when input is close to valid
Provide actionable feedback so users know exactly what to add
anti_patterns: Skipping validation when you think requirements are obvious
Accepting vague inputs like 'fix this' or 'improve that'
Rejecting input without explaining what specific information is needed
Validating without checking the user's saved project standards

faq.question: What project types are supported?
faq.answer: Any project type with saved standards. The skill checks against standards.json for validation rules.

faq.question: What happens if no standards exist?
faq.answer: The skill performs general validation to determine if enough information exists to proceed with the task.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with other skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Place it as the first step in a pipeline. It outputs structured results other skills can consume.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads user input and standards files. No data is sent externally or stored.

faq.question: Why was my input marked invalid?
faq.answer: The validation result includes specific issues found. Review the issues array for what information is missing.

faq.question: How is this different from regular prompting?
faq.answer: It enforces consistent quality gates across all requests using your predefined project standards.
